question: 1.My Aunt told me not to wear black shoes as black is the colour of sadness and un-happiness. 2.I have heard that pictures made on the carpets are allowed. clarify
answer:
QUESTION
1.My Aunt told me not to wear black shoes as black is the colour of sadness and un-happiness. Someone in my family also said that his friend saw Hazrat Ali (RA) in his dream and he told him to stop wearing black shoes. Please tell me if wearing certain colours has any effect whatsoever in one's life? 2.I have heard that pictures made on the carpets are allowed. Are pictures on carpets permissible, i.e. pictures which are walked on (such as pictures on carpets).Can we Perform Prayer in that room? Please clarify this issue.
ANSWER


Share:
1) All colors are permissible for males with the exception of saffron dyed
red or yellow attire. We have not come across any indication that black is
objectionable.(Fataawa Mahmoodiyyah Vol. 12 Pg. 331 & Vol. 8 Pg. 294). In
fact, on many occasions, Nabi (S.A.W) himself wore a black turban.
2) Pictures of animate objects are allowed on carpets or cushions only if
the heads have been effaced. (Mirqaat Vol. 8 Pg. 329 Ashrafiyyah) It is
Makrooh (detestable) to choose for Salaah a place offering distractions e.g.
in front of a mirror or picture. It is obvious that animate and inanimate
pictures are equal in this regard.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Bilaal Cassim
FATWA DEPT.
